meanings.definition: To adopt or take up again
meanings.sent1: After losing his first pet, he readopted a new puppy from the shelter.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to readopt their old traditions for the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: She readopted her favorite childhood hairstyle for a retro party.
meanings.sent4: The town readopted an ancient law to address the current issue.
meanings.sent5: The teacher readopted a successful teaching method to help struggling students.

meanings.sent1: Feeling regret, she readopted her previous decision and changed her mind.
meanings.sent2: The committee unanimously readopted the proposal after further discussion.
meanings.sent3: He readopted his favorite flavor of ice cream after trying a new one.
meanings.sent4: The team readopted their winning strategy for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: She readopted her initial idea after considering all the options.

meanings.definition: To bring back into use or practice
meanings.sent1: The school readopted the old uniform policy to maintain discipline.
meanings.sent2: The chef readopted a traditional recipe to add to the menu.
meanings.sent3: He readopted his childhood hobby of stamp collecting for nostalgia.
meanings.sent4: The company readopted a green initiative to reduce waste.
meanings.sent5: She readopted an ancient healing practice to improve her health.
